Description: Fragment of tapestry band, hemmed and applied and sewn to a plain weave ground; tapestry is decorated with a stylized human head and surrounded by geometric and heart-shaped motifs in coloured wool - now damaged - on a beige background; at top and bottom are two lines of dark blue wool; balanced plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/9-11), weft-undyed linen (S/9-11); sewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply) in running stitches; tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/grouped by 2-3/7), weft-undyed linen? (S), dark blue, red?, yellow? wool (S); three edges are hemmed and sewn and the other ragged; oversewing in undyed linen (S spun Z ply)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
